column3: [bigobj doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/reference/bigobj-increase-number-of-sections-in-dot-obj-file?view=vs-2019) and the reason why it happens in [debug only](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/error-messages/compiler-errors-1/fatal-error-c1128?view=vs-2019).

tACK eb832cd3b46a0f9abff238dfa780e4e9df05fdb7

As an aside I do get this issue with a VS2017 x64 debug built but NOT with a VS2019 x64 debug build so looks like something has been improved.

TLDR;

The root cause of the problem seems to be that when the compiler does not optimise the code the compilation fails with the "exceeded object file format error". The /Gy flag is not the cause
